00040 /******************************************************************************/
00041 
00042 ObjectAllocator::ObjectAllocator(size_t ObjectSize, const OAConfig& config) 
00043   NOEXCEPT(false) : oaconfig(config), oastats(){
00044 
00045   // set up stats struct for the manager
00046   oastats.ObjectSize_ = ObjectSize;
00047 
00048   // set the size of node based on provided configs
00049   node_size = static_cast<unsigned>(oastats.ObjectSize_) 
00050               + (oaconfig.PadBytes_ << 1) 
00051               + static_cast<unsigned>(oaconfig.HBlockInfo_.size_);
00052 
00053   // set the size of a page based on provided configs
00054   oastats.PageSize_ = node_size * config.ObjectsPerPage_ + sizeof(void*);
00055 
00056   // set the size of offset ""
00057   offset = oaconfig.PadBytes_ + 
00058     static_cast<unsigned>(oaconfig.HBlockInfo_.size_);
00059 
00060   // init the pagelist and freelist to point at null
00061   PageList = 0;
00062   FreeList = 0;
00063  
00064   // setup the first page and header
00065   ExpandPages();
00066   setup_header();
00067 }

00069 /******************************************************************************/
00077 /******************************************************************************/
00078 ObjectAllocator::~ObjectAllocator() NOEXCEPT(true){
00079   if (oaconfig.HBlockInfo_.type_ == OAConfig::hbExternal)
00080   {
00081     // need to iterate over every block, not just freelist
00082     byte_t* page_it = PageList;
00083 
00084     while(page_it)
00085     {
00086       byte_t* block_it = page_it + sizeof(void*);
00087       // now we're pointing at start of first block
00088       // (before the header and padbytes)
00089       // and can iterate over each block, deleting their label string and them
00090       while(block_it < page_it + oastats.PageSize_)
00091       {
00092         // delete each memblock, including header string
00093         delete_memblock(block_it + offset);
00094 
00095         block_it += node_size;
00096       }
00097       // continue iterating over each page, to access blocks inside
00098       page_it = increment_head(page_it);
00099     }
00100   }
00101 
00102   // iterate over and delete each page
00103   while(PageList)
00104   {
00105     byte_t *todelete = PageList;
00106     PageList = increment_head(PageList);
00107     delete [] todelete;
00108   }
00109 }

00111 /******************************************************************************/
00127 /******************************************************************************/
00128 void* ObjectAllocator::Allocate(const char *label) NOEXCEPT(false){
00129   // just use new to allocate if configured to do so
00130   if(oaconfig.UseCPPMemManager_)
00131   {
00132     byte_t* newobj;
00133     try
00134     {
00135       newobj = new byte_t[oastats.ObjectSize_];
00136     }
00137     catch (std::bad_alloc &)
00138     {
00139       throw OAException(OAException::E_NO_MEMORY, 
00140         "ExpandPages: No system memory available.");
00141     }
00142 
00143     // update the stats
00144     oastats.Allocations_++;
00145     oastats.ObjectsInUse_++;
00146     oastats.FreeObjects_--;
00147     if (oastats.ObjectsInUse_ > oastats.MostObjects_)
00148       oastats.MostObjects_ = oastats.ObjectsInUse_;
00149 
00150     return newobj;
00151   }
00152   // otherwise, uses the custom ObjectAllocator
00153 
00154   // first checking to see if there is free space in the current pages
00155   if (FreeList == 0)
00156   {
00157     // creates a new page (checking if > maxpages done in ExpandPages())
00158     ExpandPages();
00159     // and sets up the correct type of header
00160     setup_header();
00161   }
00162 
00163   // update the stats
00164   oastats.ObjectsInUse_++;
00165   oastats.Allocations_++;
00166   oastats.FreeObjects_--;
00167   if (oastats.ObjectsInUse_ > oastats.MostObjects_)
00168     oastats.MostObjects_ = oastats.ObjectsInUse_;
00169 
00170   // grab the first unallocated block from the free list
00171   byte_t* ret = FreeList;
00172   // and increment the free list to point at the next available block (or null)
00173   FreeList = increment_head(FreeList);
00174   // if debug is on, set the block to allocated pattern
00175   if(oaconfig.DebugOn_) 
00176     std::memset(ret, ALLOCATED_PATTERN, oastats.ObjectSize_);
00177   //set inuse flag in the header, as necessary for the header type
00178   update_header(true, ret, label);
00179   // give the block to the user
00180   return ret;
00181 }

00183 /******************************************************************************/
00195 /******************************************************************************/
00196 
00197 void ObjectAllocator::Free(void *Object) NOEXCEPT(false){
00198   // just use delete if bypassing the custom manager
00199   if (oaconfig.UseCPPMemManager_)
00200   {
00201     delete [] reinterpret_cast<byte_t*>(Object);
00202     // still, update the stats
00203     oastats.ObjectsInUse_--;
00204     oastats.Deallocations_++;
00205     oastats.FreeObjects_++;
00206     return;
00207   }
00208   // if debug is on, perform checks against user error
00209   if(oaconfig.DebugOn_)
00210   {
00211     // check bad boundary
00212     byte_t* findpage = PageList;
00213     while (findpage)
00214     {
00215       // first the object must be found, by comparing addresses
00216       if (reinterpret_cast<byte_t*>(Object) >= findpage &&
00217           reinterpret_cast<byte_t*>(Object) < findpage + oastats.PageSize_)
00218       {
00219         // if the address given to be freed from the client is not what was
00220         // given to them, throw out of boundary error
00221         if (((reinterpret_cast<std::size_t>(Object) - offset - 
00222               reinterpret_cast<std::size_t>(findpage) - 
00223               sizeof(void*)) % node_size) != 0)
00224           throw OAException(OAException::E_BAD_BOUNDARY, 
00225             "Free: Object out of boundary.");
00226       }
00227       // keep looking through all the pages until the object is found
00228       findpage = increment_head(findpage);
00229     }
00230     // check double free
00231     if (CheckIfFree(Object))
00232       throw OAException(OAException::E_MULTIPLE_FREE, 
00233         "Free: Object already freed.");
00234     // check corrupted block
00235     if (!validate_object(reinterpret_cast<byte_t const*>(Object)))
00236       throw OAException(OAException::E_CORRUPTED_BLOCK, 
00237         "Free: Block is corrupted.");
00238   }
00239   // update the stats to reflect the newly freed block
00240   oastats.ObjectsInUse_--;
00241   oastats.Deallocations_++;
00242   oastats.FreeObjects_++;
00243   // casting the object for use in helper functions
00244   byte_t* freed = reinterpret_cast<byte_t*>(Object);
00245   // if debug is on, then set the entire block to the freed pattern
00246   if(oaconfig.DebugOn_) 
00247     std::memset(Object, FREED_PATTERN, oastats.ObjectSize_);
00248   //clear in use flag
00249   update_header(false, freed);
00250   // push the freed block onto front of the freelist
00251   push_front(FreeList, freed);
00252 }

00254 /******************************************************************************/
00268 /******************************************************************************/
00269 unsigned ObjectAllocator::DumpMemoryInUse(DUMPCALLBACK fn) const {
00270   //if the block is in use, callback fn on that block
00271   //give the callback the object itself that's in use and it's size
00272   byte_t* page_it = PageList;
00273   unsigned count = 0;
00274 
00275   while(page_it)
00276   {
00277     byte_t* block_it = page_it + sizeof(void*);
00278     //now we're pointing at first block
00279     while(block_it < page_it + oastats.PageSize_)
00280     {
00281       // if the block is in use
00282       if(!CheckIfFree(block_it + offset))
00283       {
00284         // then supply its information to callback
00285         fn(block_it + offset, oastats.ObjectSize_);
00286         // and increment the count of in use blocks
00287         ++count;
00288       }
00289       // continue iterating over each block in the page
00290       block_it += node_size;
00291     }
00292     // continue iterating over each page in the pagelist
00293     page_it = increment_head(page_it);
00294   }
00295   // supply the number of in use blocks
00296   return count;
00297 }

00299 /******************************************************************************/
00313 /******************************************************************************/
00314 
00315 unsigned ObjectAllocator::ValidatePages(VALIDATECALLBACK fn) const {
00316   //if the block is corrupted callback fn on that block
00317   //exactly the same as dumpmemory except calls validateobject instead of 
00318   //checkiffree
00319   byte_t* page_it = PageList;
00320   unsigned count = 0;
00321 
00322   while(page_it)
00323   {
00324     byte_t* block_it = page_it + sizeof(void*);
00325     //now we're pointing at first block
00326     while(block_it < page_it + oastats.PageSize_)
00327     {
00328       // if the block is corrupted
00329       if(!validate_object(block_it + offset))
00330       {
00331         // then supply its information to the callback
00332         fn(block_it + offset, oastats.ObjectSize_);
00333         // and increment count of corrupted blocks
00334         ++count;
00335       }
00336       // continue iterating over all blocks in the page
00337       block_it += node_size;
00338     }
00339     // continue iterating over all pages in the pagelist
00340     page_it = increment_head(page_it);
00341   }
00342   // supply the number of corrupted blocks
00343   return count;
00344 }

00461 /******************************************************************************/
00469 /******************************************************************************/
00470 void ObjectAllocator::ExpandPages(void) NOEXCEPT(false){
00471   if (oastats.PagesInUse_ >= oaconfig.MaxPages_)
00472   {
00473     throw OAException(OAException::E_NO_PAGES, 
00474       "ExpandPages: Max pages has been reached.");
00475   }
00476   oastats.PagesInUse_++;
00477   //must allocate a block of memory to fit number of objects in the page with 
00478   //room for a pagelist pointer
00479   byte_t* newpage;
00480   try
00481   {
00482     // this is done by using the given pagesize
00483     newpage = new byte_t[oastats.PageSize_];
00484   }
00485   catch (std::bad_alloc &)
00486   {
00487     throw OAException(OAException::E_NO_MEMORY, 
00488       "ExpandPages: No system memory available.");
00489   }
00490 
00491   if(oaconfig.DebugOn_) 
00492     std::memset(newpage, UNALLOCATED_PATTERN, oastats.PageSize_);
00493   //must cast the page of memory as a generic object in order to add it to 
00494   //the pagelist, this is done in push_front
00495   push_front(PageList, newpage);
00496   // increment the number of freeobjects to reflect the new page being added
00497   oastats.FreeObjects_ += oaconfig.ObjectsPerPage_;
00498 
00499 
00500   // loop to create linked list to keep track of free memory objects
00501   for (size_t i = sizeof(void*); i < oastats.PageSize_; i += node_size){
00502     // sets the pad bytes in front of the block to the padpattern
00503     std::memset(newpage + i + oaconfig.HBlockInfo_.size_, PAD_PATTERN, oaconfig.PadBytes_);
00504     // sets the pad bytes in back of the block to the padpattern
00505     std::memset(newpage + i + offset + oastats.ObjectSize_, PAD_PATTERN, oaconfig.PadBytes_);
00506     // adds each block to the freelist
00507     push_front(FreeList, newpage + i + offset);
00508   }
00509 }

00511 /******************************************************************************/
00525 /******************************************************************************/
00526 bool ObjectAllocator::CheckIfFree(void* Object) const{
00527   switch (oaconfig.HBlockInfo_.type_) {
00528     // hbNone
00529     case OAConfig::hbNone:
00530     {   
00531       // gets head of the freelist
00532       byte_t* current = FreeList;
00533       // iterates through the freelist
00534       while(current)
00535       {
00536         // and directly compares addresses
00537         if(current == reinterpret_cast<byte_t*>(Object))
00538           // returning true if the address was found on freelist
00539           return true;
00540         // otherwise, continues looking through freelist
00541         current = increment_head(current);
00542       }
00543       break;
00544     }    
00545     // hbExtended - same check as hbBasic, so it falls through
00546     case OAConfig::hbExtended:
00547     // hbBasic
00548     case OAConfig::hbBasic:
00549     {
00550       byte_t* current = reinterpret_cast<byte_t*>(Object);
00551       // just looks at the free bit of the block
00552       if(!*(current -1 - oaconfig.PadBytes_))
00553         // returning true if free bit was 0
00554         return true;
00555       break;
00556     }
00557     // hbExternal
00558     case OAConfig::hbExternal:
00559     { 
00560       byte_t* current = reinterpret_cast<byte_t*>(Object);
00561       // looks at the external header for the block
00562       MemBlockInfo** extheader = 
00563         reinterpret_cast<MemBlockInfo**>(current - offset);
00564       // and checks the in_use parameter
00565       if(!((*extheader)->in_use))
00566         // returning true if in_use was 0
00567         return true;
00568       break;
00569     }
00570   }
00571   // if the block wasn't found to be free in above switch stament, it isn't
00572   // so return that it is in use
00573   return false;
00574 }

00576 /******************************************************************************/
00590 /******************************************************************************/
00591 ObjectAllocator::byte_t* ObjectAllocator::increment_head(byte_t* head) const{
00592   // increments the provided node and returns the next node
00593   GenericObject* list = reinterpret_cast<GenericObject*>(head);
00594   list = list->Next;
00595   return reinterpret_cast<byte_t*>(list);
00596 }
00597 
00598 /******************************************************************************/
00612 /******************************************************************************/
00613 void ObjectAllocator::push_front(byte_t* &head, byte_t* newhead){
00614   // just pushes the provided node to the front of the provided list
00615   GenericObject* oldhead = reinterpret_cast<GenericObject*>(head);
00616   GenericObject* newlist = reinterpret_cast<GenericObject*>(newhead);
00617   newlist->Next = oldhead;
00618   head = newhead;
00619 }

00621 /******************************************************************************/
00629 /******************************************************************************/
00630 void ObjectAllocator::setup_header(void){
00631   /* note that the cases for the basic, extended and external header blocks 
00632   all just increment through each block in the freelist, initializing the 
00633   memory for the header blocks. this doesn't overwrite any current header block
00634   data because setup_header is only called when a new page is created, so the
00635   only blocks on the freelist are those in the new page. */
00636 
00637   switch (oaconfig.HBlockInfo_.type_)
00638   {
00639     // hbNone - no header block so do nothing
00640     case OAConfig::hbNone:
00641     {
00642       break;
00643     }
00644     // hbExtended - same implementation as hbBasic, so falls through
00645     case OAConfig::hbExtended:
00646     // hbBasic - sets up the headerblock by setting its memory to 0
00647     case OAConfig::hbBasic:
00648     {
00649       // handles an edge case i was having where the first block's
00650       // header wasn't initialized to 0
00651       byte_t* edgecase = PageList + sizeof(void*);
00652       std::memset(edgecase, 0x00, oaconfig.HBlockInfo_.size_);
00653 
00654       byte_t* current = FreeList;
00655       while(current)
00656       {
00657         // sets the current block's header to 0
00658         std::memset(current - offset, 0x00, oaconfig.HBlockInfo_.size_);
00659         // continues iterating over the freelist
00660         current = increment_head(current);
00661       }
00662       break;
00663     }
00664     case OAConfig::hbExternal:
00665     {
00666       byte_t* current = FreeList;
00667       while (current)
00668       {
00669         // prepare the pointer to the external header block
00670         MemBlockInfo** extheader = 
00671           reinterpret_cast<MemBlockInfo**>(current - offset);
00672         // create memory for the external header block
00673         *extheader = new MemBlockInfo;
00674         // and initialize its parameters
00675         (*extheader)->label = 0;
00676         (*extheader)->in_use = false;
00677         (*extheader)->alloc_num = 0;
00678         // continue iterating over the freelist
00679         current = increment_head(current);
00680       }
00681       break;
00682     }
00683   }
00684 }
00685 
00686 /******************************************************************************/
00704 /******************************************************************************/
00705 void ObjectAllocator::update_header(bool inuse, byte_t* Object, 
00706   const char* label){
00707 
00708   switch (oaconfig.HBlockInfo_.type_)
00709   {
00710     case OAConfig::hbNone:
00711     {
00712       break;
00713     }
00714     case OAConfig::hbExtended:
00715     {
00716      // accesses and updates the inuse bit in the header block
00717      *(Object -1 - oaconfig.PadBytes_) = inuse;
00718      // if the block is in use
00719      if (inuse)
00720      {
00721        // access the alloc_num parameter in the header block 
00722        // and update it with the number of allocations that have occurred
00723        *(Object - offset + 3) = static_cast<byte_t>(oastats.Allocations_);
00724        // also update the number of times this block has been used
00725        (*(Object - offset + 1))++;
00726      }
00727      else
00728        // otherwise the block is freed, so clear the alloc_num parameter
00729        *(Object - offset + 3) = 0;
00730      break;
00731     }
00732     case OAConfig::hbBasic:
00733     {
00734       // clear the whole header block, because we are updating it anyway
00735       std::memset(Object - offset, 0x00, oaconfig.HBlockInfo_.size_);
00736       // if the block is in use
00737       if (inuse)
00738         // then update its alloc_num parametr with number of allocs
00739         *(Object - offset) = static_cast<byte_t>(oastats.Allocations_);
00740         // and update the inuse bit with the given information
00741         *(Object -1 - oaconfig.PadBytes_) = inuse;
00742         break;
00743     }
00744     case OAConfig::hbExternal:
00745     {
00746       // set up the pointer to the external header
00747       MemBlockInfo** extheader = 
00748         reinterpret_cast<MemBlockInfo**>(Object - offset);
00749       // udpate the inuse parameter of the external header
00750       (*extheader)->in_use = inuse;
00751       // if the block is now in use
00752       if (inuse)
00753       {
00754         // then update its alloc_num with the number of allocations
00755         // that have occurred so far
00756         (*extheader)->alloc_num = oastats.Allocations_;
00757         // if a label was supplied
00758         if(label)
00759         {
00760           // get the length of the supplied label
00761           unsigned len = static_cast<unsigned>(std::strlen(label) + 1);
00762           try
00763           {
00764             // and try to allocate memory for the string
00765             (*extheader)->label = new char [len];
00766           }
00767           catch (std::bad_alloc &)
00768           {
00769             throw OAException(OAException::E_NO_MEMORY, 
00770               "update_header: No system memory available.");
00771           }
00772           // copy the label into the new character array
00773           std::memcpy((*extheader)->label, label, len*sizeof(char));
00774         }
00775       }
00776       // otherwise the block has been freed
00777       else
00778       {
00779         // so delete the character array
00780         delete [] (*extheader)->label;
00781         // and clear the other parameters
00782         (*extheader)->label = 0;
00783         (*extheader)->alloc_num = 0;
00784       }
00785       break;
00786     }
00787   }
00788 }
00789 
00790 /******************************************************************************/
00804 /******************************************************************************/
00805 bool ObjectAllocator::validate_object(byte_t const* Object) const{
00806   /* this validates by looking at the pad bytes to make sure that they still 
00807      match the padpattern and haven't been scribbled into so if there is no 
00808      padding, then the object is valid as far as this function is concerned */
00809   if (oaconfig.PadBytes_ == 0) 
00810     return true;
00811 
00812   unsigned i = 0;
00813   /* starts two pointers, one at the end of the padding on the left and the 
00814      other at the beginning of the padding on the right. decrements the
00815      pad_left address and increments the pad_right address until all of the
00816      padbytes have been looked at */
00817   for (byte_t const *pad_left = Object - 1, 
00818        *pad_right = Object + oastats.ObjectSize_;
00819        i < oaconfig.PadBytes_;
00820        ++i, --pad_left, ++pad_right) 
00821   {
00822     // if the padbytes have been scribbled into, return false
00823     if (*pad_left != PAD_PATTERN || *pad_right != PAD_PATTERN) 
00824       return false;
00825   }
00826   // if padbytes weren't scribbled into, the object is valid
00827   return true;
00828 }

00830 /******************************************************************************/
00841 /******************************************************************************/
00842 void ObjectAllocator::delete_memblock(void* Object){
00843   // access the provided block
00844   byte_t* current = reinterpret_cast<byte_t*>(Object);
00845   // access the block's header
00846   MemBlockInfo** extheader = reinterpret_cast<MemBlockInfo**>(current - offset);
00847 
00848   // delete the label string
00849   delete [] (*extheader)->label;
00850   // and the header block
00851   delete *extheader;
00852 }
